intro: Orchis papilionacea subsp. bruhnsiana, commonly known as the Brühns' butterfly orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, butterfly-like flowers that are typically pale purple or white in color. The plant is perennial and thrives in moist, calcareous soils, often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by specific bee species, highlighting its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
